Text: Thank you, from a silent majority of downloaders...
Just now got round to actually watching this one, and it's actually quite good; especially the "Freedom File" and "The Plain Truth" segments.

Looks like it is time to start researching Castle, Stand Your Ground, Riot, Looter and Justified Shooting doctines in the state statutes.

http://jpfo.org/rabbi/rabbi-flash-mobs.htm
http://jpfo.org/rabbi/rabbi-while-still-can.htm

http://www.cabelas.com/catalog/browse/shooting-black-powder-pistols-revolvers/_/N-1100201/Ns-MIN_SALE_PRICE?WTz_l=SBC%3Bcat104792580&WTz_stype=GNU

http://www.cabelas.com/catalog/browse/shooting-black-powder-rifles/_/N-1100200/Ns-MIN_SALE_PRICE?WTz_l=SBC%3BMMcat104792580%3Bcat104701680&WTz_stype=GNU

600,000 plus died during the U.S. War Between the States using these antique weapons, weapons with an effective 50-200m range...   The tactics employed were dated, but the deadly effect of a .44cal ball round with 30-60 grain of black powder from a revolver or a .50, .54, .58 even .69cal mini ball round from a black powder rifle is not disputed.  

Check with your local gun club, we have Black Powder weekends once a month at the range.  I use a 1863 Zouave .58cal Rifle and at 300m, those watermelons never see it coming and you'd be shocked to see how fast you can aim, fire and hit 6 targets with a Remington 1858 New Army revolver at 50-75m...  With my 1847 Walker I can punch through 4 old stacked cars doors and still blow apart the looting watermelon hiding behind.

I'm not saying Black Powder is a first line of defense, use modern smokeless weapons as a first choice always, but having that 6 shot .44cal 1851, 1860 or 1858 revolver loaded, primed and holstered on your hip...  Well, less than $300 on an antique copy revolver or rifle might just save your life when some of those 300 pound pumped up rioters-looters decide your home or business is next on the list to destroy and your life is in danger!
